Posts.Content: Mar 8, 2012 08:43AM MTnester wrote: You will find much information and support here at BCO. I agree with sewing nut, you'll have a more clear idea of treatment when you get your pathology report. I hated the in between time in my treatment...having the diagnosis but not knowing what was next. Take care of yourself and celebrate like mad when you get the drain out (hated those stnking things!).

Posts.Content: Mar 8, 2012 09:23AM MTnester wrote: I think a tylenol prior to drain removal will be good. I was a big chicken and took a pain pill - it was overkill, although I did get an awesome nap afterwards.

Posts.Title: Had masectomy a week ago...unsure what's next chapter4 MTnester

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2012 04:10PM MTnester wrote: Teri, hugs to you as you weigh your options. I am 44, and had my ovaries removed last month. My BRCA was negative but I have an aunt with ovarian cancer, a father with prostate cancer, and a sister with oral cancer. One thing my MO suggested was that I get Zoladex injections fora few months before having the ovaries removed. It shuts them off and simulates menopause. Her thinking was if I couldn't handle the side effects, she would hold off on the oopherectomy. I have to say the side effects are better now than they were on Zoladex. Take care of yourself Teri!
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed...what about ovaries TeriR Deirdre1

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2012 01:04PM MTnester wrote: I got mine two days before my BMX. I thought to myself, NOT FUNNY haven't I had enough?! I went into the OR in my own undies/pad and woke up in hospital undies and pad. As for sex after surgery....we waited until things were a little less sore, and became more creative with positions out of my abnormal and psychotic fear of popping my TE's. I love this place, absolutely nothing is off topic!
